title: System Tray Integration
content:
## What is the System Tray?

The Windows system tray (notification area) is located in the bottom-right corner of your taskbar.

When minimized, the application continues running in the system tray with a projector icon ðŸ“½ï¸.

## Finding the Tray Icon

1. Look in the bottom-right corner of your screen
2. Find the projector icon ðŸ“½ï¸ among other tray icons
3. If hidden, click the **Show hidden icons** arrow (Ë„)

## Tray Icon Actions

**Hover:**
- Shows tooltip with current status
- Format: "Projector Control - [Name]: [State] ([Input])"
- Example: "Projector Control - Conference Room A: On (HDMI1)"

**Double-Click:**
- Restores the main window
- Brings app to foreground

**Right-Click:**
- Opens quick action menu (see below)

## Quick Action Menu

Right-clicking the tray icon shows:

**[Projector Name]** - Header (bold, gray background)

---

**Power On** - Quick power on (green circle icon)
**Power Off** - Quick power off (red circle icon)
**Blank Screen** - Toggle blank (screen icon)

---

**Show Main Window** - Restore window (window icon)
**Settings** - Open settings (gear icon)

---

**Exit** - Close application completely (X icon)

## Notifications

When operations complete in the background:
- Small notification balloon appears
- Shows operation result (success/failure)
- Auto-dismisses after 5 seconds

Enable/disable in **Settings > General > Show notification balloons**

## Minimize vs. Close

**Minimize (not close):**
- Window hides
- App stays in tray
- Click tray icon to restore

**Close (Exit from tray):**
- Right-click tray icon > **Exit**
- Application closes completely
- Removes from tray

> **Tip:** Use tray menu for quick power control without opening the main window!
